thread.title: McGrath working on upsize

author: afr.com
title: McGrath working on upsize
text:
John McGrath owns around 60 per cent of ASX aspirant McGrath Estate Agents. by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald Jake Mitchell McGrath Estate Agents is understood to be working on an acquisition that would boost the size of the company's planned initial public offering to around $300 million.
Sources said the acquisition, believed to involve a number of real estate agencies, would provide the company with a material earnings uptick. Street Talk revealed McGrath was forecasting earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation of $20 million to $22 million for fiscal 2016.
It's understood the earnings boost would see McGrath valued around $300 million, compared to $200 million before the acquisition.
The company run by high-profile real estate agent John McGrath is targeting a November listing.
John McGrath owns around 60 per cent of the business, while chief operating officer Geoff Lucas owns 10 per cent. It's understood management will not sell more 25 per cent of their holdings into the IPO.
McGrath's expansion into Victoria is understood to be well under way, with the company expected to have four to six Melbourne-based franchises by Christmas.
